history.text: Good evening!
So, we're Iron Man fans I guess.  What's the best part of the Iron Man movies?
Hello, how are you?
Yes, I really like Marvel Comics movies!
Good deal, so do I.  A big fan of the comics themselves too, they've done a fantastic job of creating the MU.
I enjoyed the characters, like Robert Downey Jr. and Terrence Howard.
Except for the FF of course.  Another topic for another day I think....
What did you like about the movie?
Yes, Robert Downey Jr nailed it.  Too bad Terrance couldn't continue his role, but Don Cheadle has done great too.
Gwyneth Paltrow did a pretty good job too!
Downey's performance, but I liked the updated version of his origins.
Some good easter eggs too, I saw the Ten Rings hints in there.
Paltrow did well too, although I'm not a fan of her's.
I like the fact that the character Tony Starks was portrayed as a "playboy".
Yes, that part was even better than the comics.  They have to water some of that down in the print version.
Yes, I agree.  I also liked how the included some realism within the settings of the film and included Afghanistan as "war-torn".
It was good to see how seeing the first hand reality of that opened Stark's eyes to what his weapons were doing.
Exactly! And the fact that Stark was offered freedom for the exchange for a Jericho missile was epic, further helping him see the horrors of his weapons.
The ending was neat where he copped to being Iron Man, setting up the sequel.  The comics made a big deal of his secret identity for decades.

Oh, I did not realize that his identity was was a secret.  Going back to his weapons....I also think the fact that the missile ended up in the hands of the Ten Rings anyway, and was used to attack Yinsen's home village really helped to shape his view of his weapons.
True.  It was fun to see him go back there with the Mark 2 armor to get some payback.
Yes, that was really fun to watch.  I just realized that he revealed his identity in an attempt to end the attack...that's really cool!
I'm sure it made IM2 much easier to write, without that added complication.
Yes, I'm sure.
What did you think about Stane ambushing Stark at his home?

I knew it would happen at some point, he'd been outed as the bad guy by then and his attack on the mercenaries in Afghanistan showed he had some cool tech of his own.  It was just a question how Tony would recover and vanquish Stane.
The Stane character was really cool in the comics as well, I wish they'd done more with him.
Yes, I agree and the fight between Stark and Stane was pretty cool as well!
Yes.  The Iron Monger armor was wicked looking.
It was! The massive electrical surge that caused Stane's death was pretty wicked too!
Yes, the way they incorporated the Arc reactor into the death scene!  Good to see Stane done in like that.
Yes it was.  Now, I see that Stark publicly announced that he was Iron Man at the press conference.

The last lines of the movie, I think.  The whole plan to lie about everything goes out the window as Stark blurts out the thing that's on the top of his head.  Then it cuts to the credits so we wonder about everyone's reaction.  Well played, I thought.
Indeed, well played indeed!  It really sets the scene for the sequel.
Yep.
Well, I'm heading out.  Good luck!
Thank you, you too!
